comment._content: LOC, the caption says "Lanthelme's", not Lanthelmes This is a crop of an original Agence Rol photo on the Gallica site: gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b6919954k Caption: caveau de Mlle Lanthelme [profané par des voleurs au Père-Lachaise] "Tomb of Miss Lanthelme, desecrated by robbers at Père-Lachaise" Published 1911 <a href=" The tomb-robbing, which took place on 12/21/11, is the subject of this New York Times report: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A07E3DA1231E2... The tomb held the body of Genevieve (identified as Lucie by the Times) Lantelme (as the Times and most others spelled it), a famous beauty and comic actress of the era, who had drowned that summer (apparently accidentally) on the yacht of her millionaire husband, Alfred Charles Edwards. Some illustrated blog entries on Lantelme: rarevintage.blogspot.com/search/label/Lantelme Including one on her 2 burial sites in Paris: appl-lachaise.net/appl/article.php3?id_article=2757
